intro: Mezoneuron kauaiense, commonly known as the Kauai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Mezoneuron kauaiense is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
